reviews.text: We had an absolutely amazing time at the Halifax Citadel. The staff was amazing! Patient and willing to field all questions. Fabulous displays. My favourite part was the pipes and drumming demonstration. Beautiful view from just about everywhere. Very easy to find with parking available for a nominal fee. Ask them about their children's programming.

This was a really interesting piece of Canadian history.  When I was here there were actors who really helped to create a unique experience. It was very interesting to learn more about how the Citadel played a strategic role for Canada.

Excellent place to learn and experience history! This was one of the last stationary defense ever built and as such is the architectural culmination of all fortress-type buildings preceding it. The site is very well preserved and that combined with the re-enactors its like being taken back in time. Be sure to plan enough time to walk the grounds and walls as well as watch the demonstrations and changing of the guard. You won't regret it!

This is a great spot to view parts of surrounding Halifax city. Drive around, stop in one of several 'rest spots'. Check out the construction techniques...we CANNOT create walls this impressive anymore. Part of the 'lost technology' class.
The guides there are very knowledgeable. Great place to learn about the history of Canada's military. It gets cold in the winter though, so I suggest going when it's warm outside.

We loved their extra March break activities, it was a great visit for a two and three year old! They also really enjoyed the current "Canada play" exhibit. We took part in a scavenger hunt and made some water themed crafts. The staff were great, interactive and enthusiastic.

Great price and great exhibits. Loved the Titanic part even though it was sad to read about. Learned some new facts. Also enjoyed reading and learning about the Halifax explosion. Definitely recommend going if you are in that area. Merlin the parrot is also a great addition.

Great place to visit in Halifax.   Spent a couple of hours here.  Very reasonable price and nice exhibits.

The Halifax explosion documentation and amateur radio hands on bit was excellent

Fun - there is lots of local history, and a nice mix of text, pictures, models, and some pretty impressive historical artifacts.  Also a parrot.  If you are thinking of bringing kids, I would make sure that they were into boats or military history first.  Although it is very interesting for me now, as a kid going I remember being bored.  The models, the parrot, and the hand-operated engines would still be fun.
Maritime Museum was an eye opener. Specifically the part where there were a lot of miniature ships with extensive details. Highly recommended to go. Also loved the life size torpedo!
Beautiful historic church,good acoustics for a concert.Importantly beautiful people there too!

St. Paul's Anglican Church is Halifax' oldest church. You can find some plaques with additional information about the building nearby. While it's impressive that this building still stands, it certainly needs better maintenance. It looks as if it were about to fall apart during the next storm. Also, it isn't possible to visit the church regularly which is a pity given its historic importance.

Quiet, yet screaming with stories to be told. 
This quaint chapel still has evident scars from the Halifax Explosion of 1917.
Worth the stop if you are in the downtown area.
We really enjoyed our time here during Nocturne 2018 with the Polaris choir and the choral work by Jason Noble.

A great piece of history. Thanks to the gentleman inside who walked us through some of the most interesting parts we learned so much.

This is one of the oldest buildings in Halifax, and has some amazing ties to historical events.

One of the original stained glass windows remains in the church — see if you can find it. The rest were blown out during the Halifax explosion. As you enter the church look up and you'll see a piece of steel that ended up embedded in the church wall.

There are two grave markings that date back to the 1770s.

This cathedral / church is unique in that it has a pew at the front that is dedicated to the royal family, should they come to visit.

Lastly there's some photos at the back of the church as you enter and scans of a pamphlet for a service held for the victims of the titanic.

Go check it out!

A lovely Neo-Classical style building to visit!

Free admission. Keep in mind that there are no self-guided tours, so you must take the guided tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and was able to answer our questions.

Open to the public in July and August. Free tours are offered daily. The tours are very informative and interesting. Typically spend about 30-60 minutes here. If you are lucky you may even catch a glimpse of the Lieutenant Governor!

Lovely grounds and staff. We were there to welcome the right honorable Julie Payette during her first official visit to PEI ("but I've been here many times in a previous life", she said. There is a leaky gutter on the north-eastern side so one star off.
Officially closes at 4pm but they don't let you in after 3:45pm. Would have been nice to quickly visit inside.
Beautiful rooms interesting to see the period furniture. Good guide.

Great escape from the noisy roads and pollution in the main roads of Halifax.
Gorgeous in the spring through out the summer, and it is usually busy afternoon, buy locals who loves reading, relaxing after a long day.
Beautiful park and garden. Well maintained and groomed even during the off-season. Very pleasant to take a leisurely walk during the day.

I absolutely LOVE the public gardens at any time of year but particularly in the spring and fall when it isn't too crowded.  It's a little gem of a place, full of plants that you wouldn't expect to see growing in a cooler climate.  It's well worth a visit!
Beauty spot! Got myself on of the agave seeds, but nice for a stroll any time of year.  Summer is gorgeous in there though

A great little park.  Not a lot to do unless you walk through during the nighttime Nocturne event - which is normally a great walk through the park and the city.  
Small cafe is great for coffee and ice cream.  Not too expensive but not much selection for a meal.  
Flowers, displays, and the park in general is a great walk around.  Bandstand looks great but not managed to catch a band playing there, yet!
Plenty of seats near the cafe and benches all around.  A perfect break after wandering a little of the city.
A local gem.
Really cool place to take the family for a walk to look at what once protected us back in the days.  You can almost hear the canons firing
Great little park with awesome views. Walk off the beaten trails and along the deer paths for some awesome hidden gems.

Such a beautiful place. The history of the park just adds on to its beauty.  I could spend hours there.  It's a perfect picnic spot for a family, or even if you want a first date. It has all the aspects of a wonderful first time......But I guarantee, it wont be you're last visit!

The views from here are lovely. An overall map of the site would have been helpful. I'm not sure we actually saw the whole fortification. There is lots of free parking and picnic benches in a few locations. There is a lot of history represented and it is great to be able to be do close to the cannons. It doesn't take a lot of time to but it is worthwhile if you have any interest in history or want a great place to explore or picnic. There are washrooms on site.
Quiet and relaxing and interesting and a lot of historic buildings to explore if you walk down to the water.

It has grown so much since I was young..still beautiful. Lake Champlain . The only reason it was never listed as a great lake is because u can see the other side. But,it was big enough. I was born in VT. & spent many years on & off there. Lake Champlain is a place for BBQ'S, swimming & just  escaping. Having family & or friends fun.
We always love coming down here for a walk or just to play in the field with the kids. All year they have fun stuff going on usually, kids day, fourth of July with fireworks, tons of events.
The sun is shining, a breeze is blowing, and the lake is frozen over from shore to shore. It's an amazing day on the waterfront in Burlington!

This is a great place to watch the sunset. There are lots of show's during the summer,wide variety of shops, dispensary, ferry, awesome bike path, short ride to North Beach. There is a dog park, skatepark, lots of places to sit, wheelchair accessible and lots of grass to walk on, parking,boat ramps docks, playground.

Great spot on the Lake in downtown Burlington.  Convenient to parking, docks, a waterfront walking trail, Skinny Pancake crepe shop and the Leahy museum.  More than a bit cold in the winter but usually delightful in the summer and fall.  Short walk uphill to everything in downtown Burlington, a great spot to visit.

Great little cafe for students. If you're looking for a moderately busy place to study and drink coffee it's a really decent place to go.
  
It closes a bit early, but great nonetheless.

Went there for the first time the other day. Part book shop, part cafe, I really enjoyed the aesthetic. Their prices are a touch lower than other places, and their menu costs include the taxes. They have some baked goods, these vary among vegan, gluten free, and regular options. Depending on the day, your selection will probably differ. For dairy selection, they appear to only have three choices. Soy milk or almond milk, which are extra, and the standard milk that they use. I got a mocha which was incredibly delicious. My friend got a chai latte, and it looks like they make that chai mix in house too.
I say it's worth checking out, and they have my business. I would just like different milk options such as coconut or oat milk.
Nice quiet place surprisingly next to those big trucks, delightful teas and treats, and more. Love revisiting the place like and old friend.

I only recently found Trident through a coworker with great taste, and HOO BOY do I feel like I've been missing out! A fantastic selection of books for sale, super comfortable atmosphere, coffee roasted on site, hilarious and charming staff... I could go on! They are also one of the few coffee shops in Halifax that always has gluten free and vegan baked good that aren't exclusively muffins(although Trident's muffins are delicious too)! I'm officially becoming a regular.
There were a lot of good books and my Itallian Soda was really good.

I really like this diner. Prices are excellent, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the food is excellent. They're always busy for brunch so be prepared to wait for a table but the turnover is always pretty quick and staff are efficient at getting tables cleaned and ready to go. I am yet to try a milkshake, but I hear they're amazing!

This is the best value for your money in town, I had the double Patty double cheese bacon and fries and also got the waffle burger. Please be aware that there might be a wait time. It's still got the feel and the atmosphere  of a classic dinner. Would come back again!

Honestly, I love this place. Its predictable, the waitresses know my order, I'm in and out in 30 minutes and 10$. A classic greasy diner breakfast spot that has beautiful windows with light coming in always and its efficient. The atmosphere is a exactly what you'd expect. Laminate tables, old couples and university students, business people in their only quiet solitary moments of the day reading the paper. It's also always open. They are cash only which isnt a problem for me but they don't have an ATM on site. Otherwise you're getting exactly what is being sold and it's the best.

One of the best places to get breakfast. The food is fantastic and won't break your bank. I usually go the on weekends and had to wait for a table as the place is usually full house in weekends. The staffs are great and please note that the place is a cash only place.

Great price and great food. Good for brunch. It can get a little squishy if you don’t go early enough as many people come here and eat. And when you forget to bring cash, it’s a little problematic too.

Best breakfast sandwich I have had at a restaurant. Very fast service despite being busy. I had the dirty burd, which was very good. However I was expecting more of a kick from the buffalo chicken. It's also next store to the good robot, which has interesting and unique craft beer. The portions seem small but are very hearty and are worth the price. I would recommend going closer to open if you are looking for something specific, as they where sold out of three menu items when we went. I also had a cafe mocha, which was very well made. I would love to go back as this is my new favourite savory breakfast place.
The food was great. Family friendly spot, but it's very small and gets packed quick. Prices are on the expensive side but overall a spot to try for sure

I didn't know this place is quite popular judging how they were very busy when I ate breakfast so the wait was fine.  
The lady who gave my food and loading the dishes was nice.
I ordered the one with salmon and goat cheese and I really enjoyed it.

We went there for a Sunday brunch based on the reviews and I was disappointed. First of all they asked me to pay my bill before serving my food which was awkward. If felt like instead of me tipping based on service quality, they were serving food based on my tip. I didn’t like it.
Also, it was 1pm and all the good options were sold out. I ended up ordering a Mexican style eggs and eating the eggs only. The salsa was not fresh at all or appetizing I had to scoop it to the side. 
I gave it 2 stars because of the nice atmosphere and the staff was friendly.
The food here is great. It is well spiced, well made, and good portion sizing, not too big or too small. The coffee is also excellent. The staff are cheerful and helpful.

Recently we hosted a retirement party at the Party Room at King's Palace, following a wonderful meal upstairs , then downstairs for a dance, and party  with a bar . By having our  85 guests dine upstairs from the regular menu beforehand, various friends  could make a reservation for a table then move downstairs for the party. Although the decor is dated, the party room easily acccomdated a live band , with a dance floor, area for viewing slide show, and hanging gallery of retirees photos The staff were so wonderful to work with , so pleasant and accommodating. Jack, the owner, and his wife were very helpful in making  the event a success.
The feedback from the night has been very positive from the dining room, delicious meals, to the setup for downstairs, and  to the central location for the event. and all very affordable. 
Thank you,Jack and your fine team for all your efforts.

I ordered food for my sister and I which I estimated to be about $30. When the food was delivered to us it was $50. I understand the cost because we did receive a lot of food, but the quality of the food was terrible. I have eaten in many times and never been as disappointed but today it was enough to ruin my supper tonight and I also now have left-overs that I do not look forward to eating which should never be the case with Chinese food. 
I suggest Jean's off of Robie on Spring garden rd. which is where I will be making my orders from now on.
By far, the BEST egg rolls and spring rolls in HRM!!!  New management has taken the food to whole new experience, not to be missed.
Never try to order delivery from here. Horrible customer service
Great tasting food..
Best persian restaurent in the city. Love it!
Very small restaurant but it was clean, service was friendly and prompt, and the food was great.
Food food unlike anything I had ever tasted. Pricy though.

Some of the best Persian grilled food, rice is always perfectly cooked. This couple has been doing what they do for a very long time and they are great at it. Fesenjoon is amazing and their baklava is the best in the city. They are always very kind, and the restaurant has a cozy atmosphere, everything to make you feel welcome!
Top quality. Great taste. Very good owner's. Will always come back 😁
Best Sushi in Halifax! Always fresh and great friendly service! The space is so nice! 100% recommended
Convenience store quality for average price. Sure they can make 4 rolls in 90 seconds but the quality suffers too much. Both times we said we would never go back and this time we mean it.
The most my fav sushi place in the town! Friendly service too. I have good experiences here every time.

Super cheerful friendly staff, Ko-Doraku on the bottom of the spring garden plaza is my favorite place to go for sushi, they always have great daily specials. The sushi is top notch fresh and very affordable. Dining in is always fun with great atmosphere and nice booths down back. I love the help yourself to what every you need approach and i go pretty much every week and am always greeted with very friendly hello and goodbye. 10 stars.

Best sushi in town. Very Othentic place.
 Highly recommend!

Centrally located in downtown Halifax. Love the new pedestrian enclosed road area on Argyle. I've had nothing but great experiences at this restaurant, consistently. The lobster mac n cheese is particularly delicious with a good portion of lobster in it. Friendly staff and a good beer variety.
The Dirty Burger was definitely one of the best burgers I’ve ever eaten, and I lived in PEI for 5 seasons of Burger Love! Plus the waitress had a dachshund so that was an added bonus! 😂
The lobster mac and cheese is a must try. There's almost always live music, and the decor is unique. Easily my favourite date spot.
Awesome food, good portions, decent prices, great atmosphere for a good time!

I'm sure this was a fluke, however the service I had was definitely not very good. The food was great, and easily in isolation was a 4-star worthy affair. However, we had dirty dishes (food bits left on the silverware, lipstick still on cups). Considering we were the only people in the restaurant at the time (at noon),  that's quite unacceptable.
Great staff who take their time on special diet requests. Friendly happy place with good values. Lots of delicious stuff on the menu. Love the Dartmouth location views. Best patio in the city.

You haven't lived until you have their chocolate tofu pie. And this is coming from someone who is not vegan. Wonderful staff, great restaurant that was original one to offer 100% local ingredients only.
Wonderful location and venue. Great music this evening  - Jorge Chicoy Trio! Best kept secret in town :-)
Great food, service and atmosphere...beautiful view of Halifax harbour. Great food options for those with dietary requirements. Great place to eat!
Fantastic meal all around. The cajun haddock was outstanding. Our server was great! She made multiple recommendations and all were amazing. Will be back for sure.

Great local place.  They became licensed in 2018, so they now serve alcohol.  They renovated at the same time and added to their menu with some very tasty items.  They promote local beers and food sources.
Sunday night is jazz night.  Always fun to drop by for some great music.
Happy hour is 4-6 PM weekdays.  Something on special each day.
There's also 'Wine Wednesday' where they feature a couple of wines for special prices.
During the day, it can be tough to get a seat with all the students taking up space with their laptops and coffee.

Great place for studying re: lots of outlets and quiet backspace where you don't feel in the way or obligated to buy more. It's usually quite busy and loud in the front. Great selection of baked goods and drinks. Alcohol is a great addition and their night snacks and food is really good. Certain baked goods and coffee drinks are pricey, but being so close to campus its expected. Could expand beer selection a bit

While it’s frequently thought of as a student hangout, it’s a great place to visit with the family too. Great baked good and light meals in a cozy atmosphere.

Be sure to check out the skor bars if they have them on hand!

I only started going there after their renovations. It’s beautiful. The place is great with nice arts and air conditioning and a nice view. My favourite place. It’s always packed so make sure you go early or you won’t get a seat. In the summer without students, it’s a bit less busy.
very friendly staff, strong flavorful drip coffee and a very cozy place to sit. excellent spot, will be back again and again.
Sublime food & impeccable service. Great spot for cozy date nights, we always end up talking about how great our meal & experience was for days after. 10/10!
The experience was amazing. Very quiet warm atmosphere. Reasonably priced dishes and good size portions. Great wine list and desert. I recommend this restaurant to anyone.

We dine there fairly often. Delicious food. Very accommodating. However until recently had not thought to try the steak. It may be the most tender delicious steak we’ve ever had. It’s a special Blue Dot steak specially raised in PEI. Friggen yummy !!!
Was taking here for my birthday. Small and quiet place great for that special night when you don't mind spending extra. So worth it and can't wait to go again.
Ambience of the restaurant is amazing. Staff is good. They recently change there menu it's great if you like non vegetarian cuisine.

Ordered the arctic char and it was wonderful! They source their fish as local as they can and the food tastes great! I sat at the bar and Neil was a terrific bartender. He got creative and made me my very own mocktail of apples and cucumber for a refreshing zing! Highly recommend this place for anyone who wants good quality excellent tasting food.

Delicious food in a delightful atmosphere. On a quick stopover to Halifax, a few people recommended this place to me. I was happy they could accommodate a late dinner request and that the place was still pretty full. Lyv and Mark were wonderful waiters and answered our many questions about portion sizes, which were generous. The scallops were fantastic. I will be back again!

The entire experience was first class.  Atmosphere is incredible, an old schoolhouse, tastefully updated, but retaining the wood beam charm of a historic building.  

Cocktail list is original, highlighting local distilleries in the tasty drinks.  The wine list is extensive, highlighting Nova Scotia vineyards and their unique varietals. 

They take the work out of a classic lobster dinner bringing out the best parts of the creature in-shell, but ready to eat.

  Service was attentive and charming.  Would lobster again.

A bit expensive but well worth it. Everything myself and the two others ordered was delicious. Biscuits to start. We also got a complimentary appetizer of salmon croquettas. The desert was tasty too. If I ever go back to Halifax, I would definitely go here again.
Lobster was great. Price could be more reasonable. Great all in all!
